args: Put this article into one of the following categories. Use the most specific category that makes sense. If you are unsure, respond Other. The allowed categories are: Abortion, AI, Associated Press, Birthright citizenship, CFPB, Climate, Crypto, D.C., Debt ceiling, DEI in schools, DEI in the federal government, Department of Education, Deportations, DOGE, End birthright citizenship, Eric Adams case, Expanding executive power, Federal funding, Federal grant pause, Federal office space, Federal worker buyout, Federal workers return to office, Federal workforce reductions, FEMA, Firing government watchdogs, Food safety, Foreign aid, Foreign policy, Gaza, Government shutdown, Guantánamo Bay, Health agencies' communications pause, Health care, Immigration policy, Interest rates, Iran, Islamic State, Israel, Jan. 6, Kennedy Center, NIH, NYC congestion toll, Other, Panama Canal, Pardons, Reclassifying federal jobs, Sanctions, Senior government officials ousted, Taiwan, Targeting political enemies, Targeting protesters, Tariffs, The media, TikTok ban, Transgender policy, U.S.-Mexico border, USAID, USPS, War in Ukraine, World Health Organization Respond ONLY with the category. Trump appoints loyalists to Kennedy Center board President Donald Trump was officially elected chair of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington on Wednesday, installing a new board of trustees as he furthers his executive authority to remake one of the nation’s premier cultural institutions. The Kennedy Center’s new board is composed of Trump loyalists, including White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles, White House Deputy Chief of Staff Dan Scavino, second lady Usha Vance, former transportation secretary Elaine Chao and Trump himself, according to its website. “It is a Great Honor to be Chairman of The Kennedy Center, especially with this amazing Board of Trustees. We will make The Kennedy Center a very special and exciting place!” Trump posted on Truth Social, noting he was voted in as chairman unanimously. Trump’s recasting of the Kennedy Center board breaks from tradition. The arts venue has typically been led by a bipartisan board and evenly split between Democratic and Republican appointees to ensure diverse programming. On Monday on Truth Social, Trump also named former acting director of national intelligence Richard Grenell, who is serving as an envoy for special missions, as the interim executive director of the Kennedy Center.
